description: Late 16th century, from French anagramme, formed on Greek ἀνά (aná, “up, back”) + γράμμα (grámma, “letter”). Analyzable as ana- (“up, back”) +‎ -gram (“letter”)

entries.meaning: (of words) A word or phrase that is created by rearranging the letters of another word or phrase.

verbs.description: anagram (third-person singular simple present anagrams, present participle anagramming, simple past and past participle anagrammed)
